Reviews.Title: “Speaking only for room 403 — adequate”
Reviews.Author: KenCarpenter
Reviews.Content: I had no problem with room 403 (March 4-9, 2012). Everything about it was adequate. Not thrilling, mind you, but adequate. (Except for the horrible British TV.) Clean, decent size, decent storage space, large-enough bathroom with decent water pressure, semi-comfortable bed and pillows. In the back of the hotel, so it was quiet. Good size safe in the closet. Could not regulate the radiator heat, but was told the front desk could adjust it. I simply opened a window. One morning there was no hot water, luckily I didn't need a shower that day. Breakfast was decent. Hotel staff was friendly and handled all of my routine requests promptly. The Paddington neighborhood was really nice, plenty of shops and restaurants. Nearby McDonald's had great Wi-Fi. From the hotel, very short walks to "tube" and train stations. Travel to all points in London was very easy. Biggest negative was poor Wi-Fi service, available only in the lobby, and most of the time it didn't work at all. (This hotel was booked by a college study-abroad tour company, so I can't speak to the value for the money. I'd pay up to $160/night for this room, based on the high asking prices around London.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: becky694
Reviews.Content: Came here with my boyfriend for my 20th birthday last year. The location is great, just a 5 minute walk from the train station and nice and quiet, although we came when the football was on so nowhere was really quiet!! Greeted by the staff as soon as we entered, and shown to our room. Although the stairs were a bit steep to get there, once we were in the room was lovely. Very clean, a bit small but we weren't looking for anything especially luxurious, just somewhere to sleep and chill out. Bathroom was a great size, although it took us so long to work out where the toilet was (hidden behind the door). Bed was very comfy, whole room was clean, hairdryer was supplied, we had a working TV, tea and coffee.... all we needed really!! Staff were helpful, when they were on Reception they would come straight over to the bar to serve you your drinks, although drinks were a little on the pricey side (but hey, that's London!). Breakfast in the morning was great. We had it included, so had a fry up, and then you can take your pick from the continental bit (fruit, yoghurt, bread rolls, croissants). Hotel is in a great location, right in the centre. We went off sightseeing and loved it, would come back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Shoe Box!”
Reviews.Author: britchick60
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels as well as working in many, one as the housekeeper and i can say the bathroom in our room,203 is the smallest and dirtiest i have ever seen in a hotel. There was black mould on the tiles behind the toilet, which by the way is behind the door. Black mould under the soap dish and we didnt want to use the shower when we saw how dirty the head was. I chose to have a bath and spotted more black mould coming from the overflow outlet. Our bed had no bedcover at all during our three night stay and when i mentioned it to reception they said it was being washed and they had no spare covers! The staff are however very freindly and helpfull, the hotel is in a good location for the tube and places to eat. Shame the room let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: D_R1905
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a night at this hotel in January 2012. We found the location to be excellent, as with most things in the great city - you're oly a tube ride away. Although we hadn't paid for a suite, this is what we were given and it was lovely. The corridors are a little creaky and the rooms a little tired, but nothing to put you off totally. Would not hesitate in staying here again. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Near Paddington, cheap, but not comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: eva_magoulias
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a typical London hotel, our room a triple was OK in size, the bathroom had a shower in the bathtub which was all right up to the last night. One of the boys had a shower and then someone from reception knocked on the door saying there was a leak to the floor below! Well, so no showers for the rest of us. But the beds were not nice, the springs creaking and bothering you (English cheap hotels donÂ´t seem to like bed matresses on top of the springs). Thing is - you want cheap, but you want to wake up rested...

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: H_S193
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the reception looked neat and tidy, however, the room was dirty, old stained curtains, dirty floor, bathroom not clean, a kettle that leaked, at TV with no reception, a hairdryer that wasn't worth turning on. We booked a double room and got a twin room, when we complained we were told the hotel was full and there were no alternatives. I slept with my clothes and covered the pillow with my fleece. When we got home we had bits all over our legs!! We have reported and sent pictures of the bathroom and sheets etc to the Environmental Health Department. Its not worth the money we paid and would never set foot there again. Stayed in london on many occasions and this is the worse hotel by far!

Reviews.Title: “sth good & sth bad”
Reviews.Author: blueice_chan
Reviews.Content: Honeymoon trip with my hubby on late Nov. Stay there for 6 nights. The first night was terrible, it was a very large triple room, high ceiling, dim lightings and dirty curtains with tears, heater and telephone is not working!! Just like in a ghost room... then I request to change to another room the day after, a double room this time, much much much more better than the previous one. I think the previous one is out of service for a long time. This time the room is very clean and bright, everything is in good condition. I think this is worth to stay in such convenience location and valuable price. The staff are all friendly and helpful. If I haven't see the first room, I'll rate this a 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaAB
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel for my Mum and Nan for a Christmas present through London Theatre Breaks (who are just as Terrible). When they arrived at the Hotel they were told their room had been Cancelled, which was not the case. Once that had been sorted out they were taken down a Smelly hall way to get to their room. When they got in to the room, well.... there were Holes in the Curtains, Holes in the bed sheets, dated furniture and not to mention the Bathroom, it was more like a wash room apart from there was NO ROOM to wash. At reception there was a women trying to explain she had No Water in the Bathroom, but they asked my mum and nan if they spoke Spanish as he did not understand what she was saying!! Mum spoke to her in English and realised what she was trying to say! All together the Hotel and London Theatre Breaks have been Unhelpful, Rude and all together not Bothered. I have tried to complain but neither of them are interested to I am trying to take things Further. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL OR BOOK WITH LONDON THEATRE BREAKS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very very basic, if You just need a pillow to put your head on...”
Reviews.Author: salgumari
Reviews.Content: well, before I booked this hotel I checked their web- nice pictures, looked renovated and average. I also checked tripadvisor of course- somebody sayd 'do not believe the whiners'... I decided to try as I am a travel agent myself and our clients often use hotels of approx the same price category and the same location (near Paddindton station). I stayed there for 3 nights when visiting WTM 2011 Travel Market. Let's start with good: location near to Paddingtin station, lots of shops, pubs, fastfood places near, I also liked the reception staff- I always got help what I needed, breakfast was quite OK for London hotel- not buffet, but still there was cheese and ham, and tomato and cucumber and yoghurt and flakes! NB!! The coffee was very very good, made to every client personally in small coffee-pot. But the room- my home for 3 nights- was so depressing: it located in cellar and was very dark, 50 cm from my window there was small garbage-box- there were lots of rubbish thown out from windows... blankets in bed and towels had holes, shower was so small that I could not even wash my legs. both- room and bathroom- just screamed for renovation. so if You need just a bed and pillow to put your head on in London centre, it is ok for You. But if You want a good stay and maybe spend more that 6 hours (night) in room, maybe even to work there a bit, pls do not book this hotel! Thanks, Norfolk Plaza, that You showed me one of the worst rooms you have, it is really importand for travel agents ;))

Reviews.Title: “norfolk plaza hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathleenphillips275
Reviews.Content: we arrived for a christmas beak !!! outside and the entrance looks grand , we were given our first room which was in the attic as you walk around the corriders there is a terrible stench of stale smoke and dirt i complained and with a bit of hestation i was offered another room which was dirty ,damp running up the bathroom walls no plugs and showerhead a disgrace all carpets are threadbearing this hotel is in need of a complete refurbishment, we ony stayed the one night but never again i found the staff unhelpfull and little engish so beware not recomended

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: AManns
Reviews.Content: Staying in London overnight to see a show. Got a good deal on rail hotel and show. This was the hotel. Great looking exterior, reception looked good, very peaceful. Reception staff were very helpful when we asked if we could leave luggage there while we took a walk and had lunch. They suggested a few places to go and eat etc. When we got back they even remembered our names. Got up to our room, it was clean and tidy,but very tired looking. Some of the bed linen needed replacing, but it was spotlessly clean. It felt as if the room had been forgotten, a bit like Miss Haversham. The staff could not do enough to help, the night porter doubled as bar staff, and was very pleasant when we got back from the show. Breakfast was OK standard egg and bacon. Would stay again if I was in London for a show.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Loveheart23
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a weekend stay. We had a hotel and show deal. When we were allocated our first room, we were pleasantly suprised considering all the reviews, was very clean and ok, quite stayable. My friend then sat on her bed and unbelievably one of the legs was missing. I rang reception and advised them of this and they swiftly allocated us to a different room. We were actually given a suite. Which was ok, except for shower not working. The rooms need a complete refurb, but i have to stress they are clean. Saying that if I was to pay Â£190.00 for the suite I would have been disgusted, as there were holes in the net curtains and shower not working. In general not worth that sort of money. Travelodge rooms are nicer!! Breakfast was ok, selection of fruit juices, cereal, rolls, croissants, ham and cheese. Again if i was to pay the Â£190.00 much more would be expected. I would stay there again as it was clean and all the staff so nice, polite and helpful. Also location is literally two minutes from Paddington.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed with the room and the costs”
Reviews.Author: sally p
Reviews.Content: stayed over the weekend to see a show as other reviews have written, the hotel gives a very false impression, excellent on the outside, entry foyer very nice, bar pleasant. Shame about the room, I have stayed in many hotels for work and pleasure, but this is I'm afraid a complete disappointment. Our room was on the top (attic) the room was clean, but OH so tired, bedding was clean but badly worn, shower was lack lustre down to the bare metal nearly all the shine had gone from all the taps and piping. little room to swing a cat. Television no remote control, net curtains dirty and grey. Overall will not be going back, breakfast was just a roll with meat or some tin fruit. But the only plus side was that the staff were very nice, which is a shame for them that the owners let them down so badly.

Reviews.Title: “oops!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: micka345
Reviews.Content: My colleague and i stayed here for one night, due to us working in the area.We request to stay in the area as it is good for places to eat and drink, shops etc.This hotel looks good when you enter the reception area, but, goes downhill from then on.When we got to our room my mate warned me about the shower,freezing or scalding in the space of seconds.further investigations found a smashed plug socket and i had to use a drawer to prop my bed up as 1 of the legs was just wedged under it.Breakfast was edible ,that is all tha t can be said about it,I am glad I stayed due to work because if it had been a pleasure trip , I would have been gutted having to stay here,

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: nicola r
Reviews.Content: We had this cheaper then average on laterooms.The staff were pleasant when we arrived and the room was clean although in need of a bit of tlc. We had come to see a show and the staff advised they coul book a taxi to take us.This was not the case because when they rang a taxi they could not do it for 45 minutes leaving me to drag my daughter and elderly mother through london to find a taxi and luckily we made the show with 5 minutes to spare. When we returned to our room it was really uncomfortably hot so we phoned down for a fan. The staff told us they would locate one and ring us back in five minutes.Twenty minutes later we rang again and was told the same thing.We rang again twenty minutes after that to be told no fans were available and they would turn the heating off in our room something they could have done an hour before! Bed was really comfortable slept like a baby. We then left our bags with the staff the next day as we had a few hours to kill. When we returned it took two staff members and forty five minutes to find one bag which meant a mad dash to victoria to catch our bus. Plus Comfortable bed Clean Minus Staff do not know the area their in Staff difficulty with english

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: LOUISEPenrith
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel as part of a theatre break although the staff were pleasant enough the room left a lot to be desired. I would not call it whinging as kjp89 calls it to expect no tiles off in the bathroom, no holes in the bedspread, thread bear carpert and a disgusting outlook. Behind a very flash reception lies an outdated and unkempt hotel. Yes the location is good but I just wanted a decent room. Aviod room 202 although after speaking to other guests it was just the same as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the rubbish 'DONT STAY HERE' comments - please!”
Reviews.Author: kjp89
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel TWICE now and it is not as bad as people are making it out to be! the outside is lovely, sitting on the edge of a beautiful garden & also the most convinience place you will find in Paddington - 2 seconds walk from the train/tube station! I also want to add - yes the floors are creaky, & i did complain about this upon my return - the VERY VERY kind staff (who by the way, are kind to you througout) - appologised profusily for the noise disturbance and i also complained the room was on the small side, but she offered me a COMPLIMENTARY stay as they hotels way of appologising. Not only this, on arrival, shed booked me and my partner into the suite. Now it isnt amazing, it is what you pay for, but the customer service is SECOND TO NON and so much more friendly than you would find in some high end london tourist areas (trust me, ive stayed there) Also this place is NO WHERE NEAR DIRTY - the room was spotless. Yes a little outdated, it could do with a referb, but for the money, it is definately worth it. Ignore the wingers! ;)

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed in worse but I have stayed in better.”
Reviews.Author: dodo2761
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the previous reviews and was worried. The hotel is ok but nothing more. Location is excellent. Staff helpful and friendly. Room cleaned immediately prior to entry. Bed good. Pillows awful. Bedding clean and bathroom clean. Light and airy room. The floorboards in the corridor do crak and you can hear other guests but they soon settled. Breakfast good. The worst thing was the constant musty smell. This probably emanates from carpets that need replacing and corridors that get no fresh air. Overall ok. Convenient and I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER- NEVER GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: linda w
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there this weekend 10 /11 sep. How i wish we had read these reports. Never have we stayed is such run down filthy place. It makes me even boak thinking about it. from the lift to corridors of worn out tatty and dirty carpets i have ever seen. And when finally we got our room, surprise there was already someone in it. Finally another room later still the pits of the earth. When we complained about it we were told that the man that owns it is lebonse and what with the war he is not going to renovate it. When we arrived it was evening if we had arrived early in the morning we would not have stayed. I am still shuddering about it... DO NOT GO.. Linda E.Yorkshire

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but accomodation could be better”
Reviews.Author: Dagje
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family end of August. Location is good, underground just around the corner. Friendly staff that was helpful with our questions. In total we had 3 rooms, two were rather spacious (for London) and one was tiny. The rooms were clean but could use some updating. Bathrooms were (in all the rooms) old and could use some renovation. We spend 2 nights but after day 1 the toilet in our room didn't work very well anymore. At one point we used the toilet in the reception area however this also didn't work very well. Breakfast was sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “convenient!”
Reviews.Author: haze73Worc
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 1 night during a visit to the theatre...after reading the reviews i was dreading staying here but was pleasantly surprised...the reception area was lovely and the member of staff on duty was lovely..unsure of his name but he was approx 20`s and wasnt english but was very pleasant and helpful with helping us find our way around london,,couldnt fault him at all.well done young man!! the rooms were adequate for our stay but although i will say they are a little over priced but everything was clean and tidy,,i didnt see any proof of what other reviewers have reported so i will just say give them a chance as the location is perfect,,nearby to paddington tube/rail station and lots of bars/restaurants to choose from within 2 mins away but without all the noise that you would expect...i would use this hotel again as we had no problems at all

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALYSON N
Reviews.Content: I have been to some hotels in my time but this was the most disgusting, run down, filthy, badly managed hotel I have ever had the misfortune to go to! Don't be fooled by the location which is very good & pretty because once inside it is a house of horrors. The rooms are dirty, peeling paint & wallpaer, threadbare carpets & curtains, beds with prickly blankets & holes in the bedspread & the bathroom includes broken tiles, peeling paint & very old fittings with hairs thrown in for good measure! You feel like you are going to catch something & are afraid to even take your shoes off & unpack. Breakfast is a joke & the staff obviously do not want to be there & are unhelpul. If you are looking for the ambiance of staying in a hostel for the unwashed then this is the place for you ~ it needs to be condemned before someone catches something! DO NOT GO HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrific - Dirty, dirty, dirty....”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night, room was rotten the nets were grey and the beds had dirty blankets and the bathroom was disgusting....the lift got stuck, staff were not particularly bothered it transpired that there was that much rubbish in the mechanism that it shortened the electric. Couldn't sleep all night due to the heat in the rooms and the fear of something crawling over you.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Steinar47 Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: Was here 4 nights in April. We were 2 adults and 1 child. The hotel was nice outside and the reception was quite nice! The rooms were very worn, but all was relatively clean and everything worked! The staff was very friendly, helpful service and proven. Close to subway and other public, transport. The hotel can be safely recommended to those who want a cheap hotel room. We will be happy to return to this hotel next time we're in London.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: lulabe11a
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for one night after going to the theatre in the West End, all I can say is thank goodness it was only one night. The hotel on arrival looked very pleasing with marble floors and a grand entrance, but do not be fooled, the glamour ends in reception. The receptionist was very friendly and gave us a key to our room which we had to go find ourselves, we took the lift which was just awful, it was incredibly small, and ancient, but not in a charming way. When searching for our room, we got lost in a maze of very narrow dark corridoors, not desireable atall. We then found our room and opened the door only to find the bed immediately infront of us, and i mean immediately there was barely half a meter walking space around the entire bed. Very cramped. The room at first appeared clean and basic, which was fine we werent expecting anything fabulous as we got it at a good price. But on closer inspection the mugs left out for us were dirty and carpet was covered in hairs. Not very romantic for our weekend break. In the morning we went down to the 'dining room' for breakfast, this was intersting. There was a reasonable choice of breakfast, continental some yoghurts and apparantly if you asked you could have a cooked breakfast, however the staff were less than approachable and looked very unhappy to be there. So in all all we were dissapointed. It is only a 3* hotel, and as students we are quite accomodating, but this hotel was less than desireable.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: lucyucy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great location and the road where it is located is lovely. Even the reception is nice. Rooms are old and run down. We came back after a night out and found a cockroach in the bathroom. Disgusting. For Â£95 for the night we expected better. Wish we'd read these reviews before we booked!

Reviews.Title: “Money wasting”
Reviews.Author: HelsinkiFinnish
Reviews.Content: If you pay more than 100 Â£ for room, you think hotel is more than one star, Norfolk Plaza info says: three stars, which is not true. Like a rathbone, staff working like trainers or not interesting to serve their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Norfolking good”
Reviews.Author: TonyCardiff_Wales
Reviews.Content: Worst night's sleep I've ever had. Room needs a good clean, bed like a bag of rocks. Here on business and now have to go to a meeting with barely any sleep. Horrible place, avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: anaiiis
Reviews.Content: I booked first and read the reviews later. Cannot complain about the price, I really got a special deal, so I decided it cannot be that horrible, plus there are some reviewers who actually really liked it. The hotel fulfills the safety requirements (two fire escapes) and I was lucky (?) to get a room on the top floor, which meant nobody was walking on top of my head (seems a bit important in this hotel). But you hear people walking outside your room anyway, very very squeeky hall and your own floor - I was lucky to be the only one in the room, but I was already annoying myself! The outdated design and linen in the room itself is nothing to brag about. It hosts a water kettle, though, thats nice, but the tea/coffe selection was awful, so bring your own. The room view was closed by a concrete wall and past visitors have obviously been smoking here. There was also an ashtray inside the room, but many smokers here obviously choose to throw their leftovers outside of the window to be stopped by this concrete wall for everyone afterwards to admire. The design of the room is very outdated if not depressing. I got a bit sad in there. The bathroom, however, was quite nice, though small. The linen and towels were fresh and clean. The matress has seen better days, but it still had sufficient firminess. If you choose this hotel, EARPLUGS are a must. I was so relieved to find out I have brought my own so in the end, I had a good night rest. They do have free interenet, if you want, but I did not have time to try out the speed. No breakfast was included for me, so you need to check that, but it's not very expensive to have one. On top of it all, the taxi they called for me, wanted a crazy price (almost double than what it should cost). If you get a good deal and budget is a must, I still think this is not the worst option to stay in London, but I do hope I don't have to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best.”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessFrodsham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Norfolk Plaza in April 2011 for a one-night stay in London. In terms of location, its pretty good. It's a very short walk from Paddington mainline / underground and set off the main road in a pretty quiet square with grass & trees in the middle. There's a few pubs nearby & the usual selection of fast food & franchise restaurants nearby. The Norfolk Plaza looks great from the outside, but goes downhill rapidly when you get in. The lobby itself is ok & the staff were pretty pleasant all the time we were there. There's a tiny "bar" which will seat four people at best and was closed when we arrived back from the theatre, which was something of a disappointment. Finding your room was a struggle too as the numbering system is completely random. We went round the floor three times before finding our room, which turmed out to be right next to the lift!! We had a twin room which could best be described as functional: two beds, small tv, bathroom. The carpets are threadbare and the decor is very tired, while the bathroom was well past its best. There was hardly any hot water in the morning. Had we been staying for more than one night, it would have been a struggle to accept. The beds themselves were just about ok, but the pillows were awful - so not a good nights sleep for me. The breakfast room ("restaurant") is also tiny and couldn't cope with the number of people wanting to get served, so we had to queue down the stairs. Again, none of this was the fault of the staff, who remained pleasant throughout. The food on offer at breakfast was basic, but adequate. So on the whole, its an average London hotel at best. Its only real plusses are the location and the price. You can pay a similar price for far better facillities out at Docklands but if you want to have a base reasonably close to the centre of London, this is ok. I wouldn't advise staying for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review - Excellent Location, But A Few Faults - Please Read”
Reviews.Author: kjp89
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night from 2nd April - 3rd April 2011 - Excellent location, roughly 2 minutes walk from Paddington Station/or Paddington Tube so excellent routes for travel. Plenty of bars/shops around (recommend 'Dickens Tavern' for some pub grub by your hotel) Front of hotel and view is fabulous, overlooking Norfolk Gardens, very nice scenary. Hotel staff very very helpful upon arrival, easy booking, not allowed to check in before 2pm however we arrived at 10am and could leave our bags safely untill we checked which was great, so we went out for the afternoon as planned. The hotel rooms themselves arent The Ritz - they are basic rooms - we had the twin room which is how its described, nothing fancy, small TV with basic channels, trouser press, hairdryer, bath/shower, kettle with tea/coffee - exactly what you would expect from a hotel room. The rooms are clearly old, the rooms themselves could do with a makeover. The 2 man issues we had were - The creaky floorboards. The slightest movement from the room above and we heard everything, 24/7. They must have been cleaning the room out in the morning as from 7am it was constant noise, you couldnt sleep through it. 2nd problem is the bathroom. If you are slightely large/overweight, you cannot stay here. myself and my partner were ok, but we barely squeezed onto the toilet which is located between the shower and a wall, and im a size 10. Pretty bad that they dont state this, but then again they wouldnt would they! Last which I thought was pretty rude was that the maid let herself in and walked in whilst i was sleeping with nothing on! I shouted 'HELLO?' as soon as i heard the door go and she replied sorry sorry and walked back out. But still, not pleasant! Luckily I was sleeping! Apart from these issues, the hotels location is fantastic, and you may get lucky with a bigger bathroom and no creaky floorboards above! I paid Â£80.00, which is slightely over what i expected to pay for what I got to be honest. But no where near the worst or as bad as people are making out!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: poshbird125 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception smart, the rest absolutely awful. Room grubby and old. was so bad we couldn't think of sleeping here. moved to another hotel up the road!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cybertyger
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at this hotel and it continues to provide good value for money. Mainly helpful & friendly reception staff. Excellent location for exploring London. Easy walk to Oxford Street & Hyde Park. Good pub over the road and 2 mins from Paddington Station.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't get a rating in Ireland our tourist board would close it down as not even B and B standard.”
Reviews.Author: mairpren Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel had only one thing going for it, location but having said that there were hotels all over the place in this part of London so if I was going again I'd be wiser. Having read a couple of reviews just before we left I had an idea what to expect just as well because coming from Ireland where accommodation standards are very high, one would assume a hotel with I think a 3 star rating would be fairly ok, not so. We booked a double room but instead of a double bed we got three single beds. Food was mediocre, most of the staff were decidedly disinterested in us though reception staff were fine. Hotel was reasonably clean but hasn't been redecorated since about 1970 or at least not the basement rooms where we were. Outside of hotel and reception look well after that it's downhill from there. Avoid if you can there is a nice Quality Hotel and Best Western not far away and even on the same street there are nicer hotels for the same money. Its was hostel accommodation for central London Hotel prices, guess they feel they can get away with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: GrKr
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel nov.17th and was a bit nervous after reading all the terrible tripadvisiors here. Was glad to find out that many people here expect to much and are just wrong. The hotel was a good 3 star hotel with a 5 star location!!! It was clean and no bad smells at all! The rom was warm, almost to warm, and the water was warm too. The staff was great. Funny and very helpful. Very good service. The only negativ experience for me was the bed. My back was in pain everyday, so I hope that they will change it soon. Realy want to go back to this hotel in the future, hopefully very soon. Please change the beds!!!! ... and get duvets...

Reviews.Title: “Central location, no central heating, staff with poor English, cooked breakfasts disgusting, continental breakfasts good”
Reviews.Author: SandyBellshill
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Norfolk Plaza for three nights. The staff were fairly pleasant and the room were clean and functional. The hotel has an air of faded grandeur about it and there was no central heating running in the rooms. The area is great for tubes, buses and trains and it was quiet at night. Avoid the full English breakfasts as they are swimming in grease and no one asks you what you would like, it just appears with everything included, (I happen to hate eggs).

Reviews.Title: “Suicidal depressing gloomy filthy hotel avoid this place at all cost!!”
Reviews.Author: alrapp
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in it should be closed down by health and safety. .The rooms were disgusting and dirty .The carpets were just plain scary I did not want to know what all the black marks were! .My room had no natural light and was in the basement it was creepy It stunk of stale smoke and damp.I was next to the restaurant and the services .The noise in the morning 6.30am was loud and the maids all talking very loudly outside my room without consideration for the guests .I could not wait to get away from this place and I feel that it is a disgrace to the name of Norfolk .Consider yourself warned .

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: gwg2009
Reviews.Content: We had booked The Norfolk Towers Hotel around the corner and when we arrived they informed us that they had to move us to Norfolk Plaza as they had a burst and it was the same quality as theirs. I beg to differ ! It was crap. Reception not welcoming, corridors about 4 feet wide with old carpets. Rooms dated, musty. We dare not look at the mattresses for fear of seeing something horrible. Out second night was in the Travelodge in Covent Garden, which is basic and cost Â£20 more because of location but it was a joy compared to the Norfolk Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst but I wouldn't go again”
Reviews.Author: greentree86
Reviews.Content: We booked this at the last minute through late rooms and for Â£85.00 we weren't expecting a large room or any particular luzuries. However the room was really small, hot and cramped. I'd also agree with the previous reviews that cleaniness is an issue here. I'd say it was grimy rather than filthy and wouldn't advise walking on the floors without shoes on. The bed was also on the small side and not very comfortable. After being constantly woken up by creaking floor boards in the room above and the noise from the air conditioning outside the window I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Looks posh but...”
Reviews.Author: Hysteriah
Reviews.Content: the lobby looks posh but the hotel is worn down. We were there in the end of marts & it was freezing cold but they only let the radiators stay warm during day time - at night when it was around zero out side the temperatures in the room were similar. The bathroom window couldn't open & was full of mold. I have tried several hotels around Norfolk Square & Sussex Gardens - I'll never use this again.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: denisjimenez50
Reviews.Content: On first view it looks really nice, and the location is great. Lobby looks really good, you think you were in a posh hotel! The reception staff was lovely. However, after we checked in we went up to our rooms as soon as you come out of the lift we said "Oh my dear God! where are we?" The corridors are narrow and very grubby, holes in doors, laundry on the floor which remained there all weekend. Our room when we walked in was the pits! The net curtains have never seen a washing machine since the day they went up. The walls were cracked, tiles in the bathroom were cracked. The bathroom was really grubby. The taps and shower were all very scummy. The bath had never been cleaned. There was dust every where. The carpets were very grubby. I wished I took my slippers, I daren't walk around with no socks on! Bed spread was torns and frayed. The blanket on the bed, yuck! I daren't sleep it with over me. The sheets, however, were lovely and white and so were the towels!! The breakfast the following morning was lovely, had a big choice and you could eat as much as you like. The dining room was lovely, so different to the rest of the hotel. It was bright, and very clean, and all very modern and new. The staff were very helpful and made us feel very welcome. Bless them. The area is very nice, with a big garden in the centre of all the hotels. There is no where you park the car near the hotel, as it is very expensive if you were paying by meter. So we parked our car at Paddington Station which was just a short walk across the square and over the road. It cost us Â£10 for 24 hours over the weekend. Which was brilliant value. We didn't have to pay congestion charges because it was a weekend. We then took the tube from Paddington to all the various places we wanted to visit. The hotel, I'm afraid was very poor for the money they charge. It is need of desperate repair, modernisation, and above all Kim and Aggy to show them how to clean it up!!! Can't fault the staff, they were lovely. Can't fault the breakfast that was very nice. It's just the Hotel - please do something about it! The amount of people who have posted their complaints on here, you would have thought something would have been done by now! Do yourselves a favour, you people who own it, clean up, or you will end up closing down!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ArJayGee
Reviews.Content: I was utterly disappointed with this hotel property. Though the hotel facade tells of a different story, the room that was set aside for our 2-day stay left a lot to be desired. The corridor and the room had such a musty smell that at certain times were too over-powering. The room itself had no appeal with bed and beddings reminiscent of the 1960's. The bathroom was the size of a closet with the shower stall no bigger than a bread box - it was so small that the soap holders were outside the shower stall! I've had better accommodations in third world countries! Beware of this property!

Reviews.Title: “Total Dump - Avoid Avoid Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Jim1974
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on travel supermarket and was listed as a four star hotel. It wasn't all that cheap but I wouldn't give this hotel 1 star. The carpets and furniture in the room were filthy. There were damp patches on the walls. The bathroom was like a fridge and there was barely enough room to squeeze through to the loo. Was amazed when the shower had hot water. Burnt my hand on the lamp in the bedroom which was unsafe. Travelled with my partner and was amazed to be put in a twin room. I think all rooms are twin rooms. For one night was good comedy value but all in all remembered for the wrong reasons. Having said all that location was good shame about the hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly decent for the area”
Reviews.Author: Lena76
Reviews.Content: In other parts of the country, you'd probably expect more from a three star hotel and about Â£80 for the night. Around the Paddington hotel district, with easy access to Paddington station, bus and tube to take one around town, I've paid more for less. Compared to other hotels on Norfolk Square, this one is on the right side of the square - the side where the back of the hotel doesn't get all the noise from the tube and where you're not woken up in the morning as the trains on the Circle line start running. There's delivery traffic in the square, but not too heavy; the situation is as quite as it gets here. My room was in the back of the hotel, towards an alley, and I couldn't hear any traffic at all even with the window open, let alone people. The room (twin for single occupancy, on the ground floor) was surprisingly spacious (again, given the area; other hotel rooms I've seen around the square have all been smaller), it had a proper writing desk and a small easy chair, and a good-size wardrobe. The decor, bed spreads and carpets had seen some use but were clean and tidy. (Having seen some of the reviews here before checking in, I must admit to checking for bed bugs!) The bathroom (with a tub and blissfully hot water round the clock) was small but had been vigorously cleaned. My one issue with the room was that I had been placed in a smoker's room; not a problem for me as I smoke myself, but one that could have been highly problematic for an allergic or asthmatic traveller - do ask for a non-smoking room if you need it! My expectations were as limited as my budget, but I was pleasantly surprised by this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad 'Hotel'”
Reviews.Author: Thatsthat
Reviews.Content: I was given room 211. The view is a brick wall. The bed cover was old, with a large frayed hole. The bathroom was dirty, mildew fungi covered all the silicone covered gaps. The matress was old rickety and made 'bong' sounds sitting on the edge of the bed. My room was changed to 111, this room had a broken washing machine for a view. The bathroom had the same mildew problem. Water leaked into the bathroom through the concrete celing. The room TV, must be the smalest on the market. The 'free' internet did not work. The passages smell badly of old cigarette smoke, are very narrow with fire doors banging, disturbing your sleep. Please stay away, avoid this very bad 'hotel', it is a disgusting smelly old dump. The Norfolk Plaza is not suitable for business or tourist visits. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: chriskGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for short stay Location good and right next to Paddington for connections to City Centre Room was a bit small and bathroom needed cleaned or an upgrade Breakfast was great and all staff were nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - try it!”
Reviews.Author: JVRBalestrand
Reviews.Content: I visited Norfolk Plaza Hotel July 30. - August 2. in 2009. I had read many of the reviews at TripAdvisor, and had low expectations. But I was surprised. I got rom 508. I was quite a large room, clean and nice. It had all the facilities that I needed. You had to learn how to flush the toilet, but then it worked OK. The shower had hot water all the time. The bed was a bit uncomfortable, though, but that was not a big problem. The staff was polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “bugs galore”
Reviews.Author: peacock22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my young children and my elderly parents. Booked in for one night because the train was late home for my children . Had 2 rooms of three which were sub standard but it was only for one night so we put up with it. Come the morning my daughter had a lot of blood spots on her face, after inspection we found that two of the beds were infested with bed bugs. Not only masses of eggs underneath the 4 layers of fitted sheets but also large walking ones. This hotel is disgusting and should have been closed down years ago!!

Reviews.Title: “No hot water no heating”
Reviews.Author: StaffordshireCharlie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night - we were in a large triple room on the top floor which was basic but clean. Our problem was that when we arrived at 6pm our room was freezing cold when we rang reception they told us the heating was due to come on.... it came on after 8 and went off 2 hours later and our room never got warm. We went to the bar for a couple of drinks and as we we starting our second drink at 10.30pm they just closed the bar and turned the tv off without a word!! The staff were not rude but they all had a cant be bothered attitude and were matter of fact with us. When we got up next morning at 8.45am we had no hot water so we left straight away without staying for breakfast. The hotel was cheap we stayed in a triple room for Â£65.00 and it was a couple of streets from Paddington which was great and it was clean but we all felt that no matter what the price we should have got basic comforts ie heat and hot water. We would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: LRO08
Reviews.Content: Very, very basic hotel rooms are clean but very dated, beds not the most comfortable either. You can hear the person in the room next to you and people on the corridors at night time plus if anybody is outside your window you can hear them! It is in a terrific location only a 5 minute walk from Paddington Station. If you don't plan on spending much time in the room and are looking for something cheap and central this hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing”
Reviews.Author: RaeSteve
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very close to Paddington station and St. Mary's hospital, not more than 5 minutes walk. I stayed in freezing conditions in January. Walking into my room I felt that I hadn't even gone inside , there was no heating. I turned the radiator on to find it did not come on. I was told they have the heating on for two hours, then off for two hours so it would come on from 8 to 10. It did, but it wasn't nearly enough to warm the room (considering that my radiator had been turned off all day). They had no blow heater or anything to give me. The response at reception was sort of shrug the shoulders. However, the conceirge was quite apologetic. Generally hotels dont advertise heating as a perk, because I think its kind of assumed. I could not believe the AA sign outside - giving this hotel 4 stars. I no longer have faith in the AA ratings - I guess they must have stayed in the summer. Clearly all the money they saved on heating goes to decorating the reception area which looks very nice (great!) I dont really have any other complaints (I did only stay one night). The room was basic, but clean. I'm giving one star because I think being warm enough to take your coat off and relax is a fundemental in my opinion for a 4 star hotel( or guest house). If I'd walked in and they didn't have a bed in the room, or there was no roof I'd give it one star then as well.

Reviews.Title: “Try elsewhere first...”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTripAdviser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on 21 and 22 October 2008, booking the hotel online because of its great location and reasonable price. When we arrived we were pleased to see that it really was only about a 2 minute walk around the corner from Paddington Underground Station. Upon our arrival the hotel seemed nice, and had a frontage nicer than the other hotels and hostels in the Norfolk Park. Reception is nicely decorated and seems newly renovated as does the bar with the nice big plasma near the reception; that is about as much praise as I can sing for this place. The lady on reception seemed very indifferent to our being at the hotel, we given Room 104 on the first floor. The only way up/down in the hotel, is a very old lift. Our room request was for a double/twin, we received a triple. The room was old, and didn't look like it had received any TLC in at least the last 20 years. The beds were terrible, they were old spring mattresses, the pillows were more like quarter filled sandbags, and the television was a generous 20 centimeter screen. Now I have stayed at many budget hotels, however at a rate of $230 a night I expected a little more. The bathroom was basic - toilet, shower, and basin, however.... Our first morning we could not get hot water for 90 minutes because the boiler was on the brink. The second morning we didn't even need to use the cold water tap because the hot water was luke warm at best. The toilet was very average, I actually got excited when I could flush everything in one attempt. We were also lucky enough to have a nicely cracked toilet seat which had been there for some time. The tiles on the bath/shower were coming off, and the shower head was very, very old. The room was also quite noisy, just beware if you have early risers above you as you can hear them walking around. We did not eat at the hotel as it was a little pricey, there are loads of little cafe's within walking distance that offer a great breakfast for between 2 and 5 pounds nearby. The concierge desk was very helpful when we checked out and happily stowed our bags for the afternoon, the man working there at least had a personality... As far as this hotel goes, it had all the basic required amenities, however it was not very nice, I would seriously consider the 30 pound hostel 100 metres from this hotel which I am sure would offer no less of a room for a fraction of the price, whilst still in the same great location. This hotel would be perfect of the owners spent a little bit of money just updating the essentials in the room, until then I would recommend elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: SomersetDaisy
Reviews.Content: As some other reviewers have stated, it looks great from the outside, but wait until you get to the rooms...my friend and I went to stay a night so we could see a few shows. The location is all that's great about this hotel. Both our rooms were like walking into a dorm...I thought it might be staff accommodation, but I feel sorry for the staff is that's true. Poorly furnished and the twin beds were VERY uncomfortable - made it difficult to sleep. I don't understand how they get such a high AA rating. And the rooms were in the 'basement', sub-ground floor. The windows were not secure (not much light either)...I could find no way of closing them completely. There were latches attached, but the screws had come out and they just hung against the window preventing one of them from closing properly. The pillows were horrible, but on opening the closet, I found some new ones that were adequate. I didn't want the Ritz but for the money, I've certainly had much better. I will say the Concierge was delightful about our bags.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: tulipmelbourne
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late after having flown from our stay in Holland. The staff were not overly helpful and the keycard to open our room didn't work which meant another trip to reception. The floors creaked, the room was old and shabby well in need of a coat of paint. The view was of other hotels rears and not at all attractive. The bathroom was not very nice and it was very difficult getting the toilet to flush at all. The beds were awful and i'm sure quite old and in need of an upgrade. The only fairly good comment i can make is that of the breakfast which was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bella2021
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past in 2003, it seems to do well due to being cheap and having a good location but it really is an awful hotel. This time we had a room in the basement, twin share. My bed had a very old spring mattress and I couldn't sleep. When we used the stairs and walked upstairs the 1st floor smelt of urine (I'm a Nurse so trust me I know the smell well). And they provide smoking rooms so the floors smell like smoke as well. We stayed in the Athena Hotel one street away the week before and it was the same price and a beautiful stay. The hotel porter was helpful but the Reception staff weren't very nice and were poorly presented. I don't recommend this hotel and won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off!!! It's fine, basic but clean and nice.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisArmy
Reviews.Content: Like most I read the reviews and thought "What have I let myself in for??". I am not fussy and would sleep on a park bench, but my wife and child couldn't be more different... they like their luxuries! In short if you want a cheap, clean hotel in a great area you canâ€™t go wrong. You get a decent bathroom, TV, Tea/coffee making facilities and a clean bedroom etcâ€¦. itâ€™s not the Hilton, but itâ€™s on par with a Travel Lodge type hotel The hotel is in the best possible location (200m from Paddington Station, lotâ€™s of restaurants, plus KFC, McDâ€™s, Burger King etcâ€¦.), the reception area is very nice, the room was clean and tidy but could have done with a bit of modernizing (i.e. new bed bases or furniture), BUT the bathroom was a LOT better than i expected, very large and clean. If you are at the back of the hotel the views are of the back of other hotels, but there is no noise from traffic etcâ€¦. If you are at the front youâ€™ll have great views of a pretty park. There were no â€˜funny smellsâ€™ during our stay. The breakfast bar is nice and the food very good, and for just Â£3.50 you can upgrade to a full English from the continental breakfast that comes with your booking. The bar area is small but nice and all the staff are friendly, and the drinks are reasonably priced (Â£2.80 for a pint of Carling) for London. We booked the hotel as it seemed to be the only room left in London under Â£200 a night which had triple rooms left. We booked the hotel direct and got a very large discount (Â£95 inc Breakfast) from the advertised rate. We stayed in room 106, so I would urge you to try and book that room if you have a child as it is big and you will not be disappointed. Just remember â€“ it is basic, but cheap and clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ThunderboltFlorida
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive from other reviews, but was pleasantly surprised! The room was small, but had a mini-bar, hair dryer, and tea pot. The room was clean and well cared for with a very firm bed. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. Breakfast in the breakfast room was reasonable by London standards. The location was excellent, just a short walk from Paddington Station, a transportation hub. There is a beautiful little park across the street from the hotel, and shopping and restaurants are abundant. The Norfolk Plaza is not a Holiday Inn Express, but Americans should not expect that in London for the rate I received, which was half of the regular room rate advertised by the hotel. I was quite happy with the Norfolk Plaza and its helpful, pleasant staff. I stay there again in a New York minute, at the price I paid!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: M1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in June 2008. As others have noted, the location is great; about 500 meters to Paddington tube stop (Bakerloo, Circle and District lines) and a little further of a walk underground to get to the main train station where the Heathrow Express comes in. It's a busy area with lots of shops and restaurants but the hotel is on a side block with a nice park in the middle. In my opinion the hotel is 2 star not 3 star. I booked a single and was given a twin so had a bit more room than I expected. The room (502) was on the 5th (top floor) and faced the back of the building so relatively quiet at night even with the window open (I found the room to be very hot). But if you plan to sleep past 8 AM bring ear plugs because the maids literally start slamming the doors to wake people up (I found this every morning, including the weekends). The room was dirty and badly in need of updating. There were some nasty stains on the blanket and bedspread. The sheets were clean though. The bathrooms was old but cleaned well on a daily basis. The door to the room was not secure at all and would be very easy to open with a hard shoulder to the door. I was very concerned with leaving anything of value in the room but luckily I didn't have any problems. There is no safe in the room. There was also no chain or deadbolt on the inside of the door to be able to secure the door when you are in the room. I booked the room using Hotwire and paid about $100 per night. I think for that price in central London, I got what I paid for. If I had paid much more than that, it would not have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SiPeirson
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this spot every month for the last 3 years during business trips to the UK.. The location is perfect ..... right next to Paddinton station and loads of Bus routes. It's also only 20mins away from Heathrow on the express. It's a 3 star hotel, so you can't expect the Hilton, but i've always found it to be fairly clean and the staff accomodating. I'd say it is perfect for short business trips or family weekends to explore London

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: LucySally
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Norfolk Plaza Hotel in March 2008. I was going as part of a student study group and had no choice in the booking of the hotel. Before I left, I looked the hotel up on their own website, which made it look pretty nice. I then looked it up on Trip Advisor and saw all the terrible reviews. I kept thinking it couldn't possibly be that bad. But it was! Everything people said was true. Being part of a student group, they automatically put us in the basement. The room was freezing! They turn the heat off completely overnight. Beds are super old twin beds that are hard, sagging, thin, with springs pushing through. The bathroom was the worst thing I've ever encountered. (See pictures) So small. I am not exaggerating that the shower (there was no tub) is a 2ft. square stall with one soap dish. There is no way to shave your legs, as there is no room to lift your leg. There was a huge push-out window in the bathroom that wouldn't close completely so it was freezing in there all the time. If you didn't shower by 7:30 a.m. the water would be cold. Some of the students and faculty stayed in rooms on upper floors that had different bathrooms that didn't seem quite as bad. So, if for some reason you must stay here, ask for an upper floor room. Although they did have same issues with cold showers and no heat. Breakfast buffet was okay. Croissants, rolls, fruit and salad. The location in Paddington was okay. There is a small park across the street. But it wasn't close to any of the museums or markets. I had never traveled to London before, so I have nothing to compare it to. I expected small rooms but not the rest of the problems. I suggest avoiding this hotel if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, filthy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barnsleyguy
Reviews.Content: Received a Christmas present of a London show with 4 star hotel accomodation in London (Bought from boots). Booked the show and was given accomodation at this hotel with the package. I booked an extra night at Â£73.50. When you arrive at the hotel you think it looks very nice from outside, and when you enter the building it looks great. BEWARE - you havent got to the bedrooms yet. Walked into the bedroom, and the first thing I noticed was the holes in the unwashed net curtains. I went to the bathroom - oh my god - filthy to say the least, the bottom of the toilet bowl was black. the grouting in the tiles was black. There was growth of some form of fungus on the window, and the bath was filthy. When i got into the bed (and i wish i hadn't) the pillowcash had holes in it, and was badly stained, the remainder of the bed linen was also disgusting. The room looked like it was last decorated just before the war - the first world war. AA have awarded this hotel 4 stars - The person who did this must have been blind and had no sence of smell. (OH DID I TELL YOU THIS PLACE SMELLS AS WELL). There is a kettle in the room, put clean water in and get dirty water out....DO NOT expect anything better than a 1 star slum if you are going to this hotel. You will get better accomodation at the YMCA. When I made my complaint at reception, the receptionist then began not to understand the English Language and all she could say is sorry. SORRY???, they have the room rates up at Â£135 for a twin room per night. I THINK THAT IS WHAT THEY SHOULD PAY YOU TO STAY THERE......By the way, did I tell you that I hated my stay there? I hove arrived back home safe, however lots of bites all over my body. Well SOMETHING enjoyed me staying there......

Reviews.AuthorLocation: St Just in Roseland, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “perhaps lucky this time”
Reviews.Author: Pagandave
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and had a very small room, this time I had a nice large twin room, quiet location and good cost Â£71. The only complaint I could have was that the kettle didn't work and the room information was very out of date. But for a quiet convenient, reasonable priced place to stay, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MrsLlewllyn
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel - no frills. Room scruffy but clean. Problems were - shower switch didn't work properly; lighting was very poor (dingy room); pillows terrible - take your own. Buffet breakfast extremely limited choice - no fresh fruit. Good things were - staff very helpful; lift (essential) ; place looked clean. Bags stored safely for you after check-out, not just left in a corner. Excellent location - easy walk with cases from Paddington station, easy access underground and buses, central location, away from busy road so no traffic noise. Expensive hotel for the state of the rooms and the breakfast, but had several advantages worth paying the extra for.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire did good!”
Reviews.Author: mklein818
Reviews.Content: The Norfolk Plaza isn't posh, and I lucked out with an upgrade to a double. But at $100 per night plus tax from Hotwire, I could have done a lot worse. The location is superb--spitting distance from Paddington Station, arguably the most serviceable of all the major London rail hubs.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference!”
Reviews.Author: captainNewDundee
Reviews.Content: We recently visited London. Our first hotel was a mistake, but fortunately, this hotel was not. It was quiet, clean and extremely comfortable. Everything about this hotel, from the staff to the amenities offered were first rate. I will recommend this hotel to anyone visiting London and needing a quiet, clean, reasonable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What's with everyone else?”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay12
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what everyone else is talking about! I stayed at the Norfolk Plaza for over a week and was completely satisfied with the cleanliness of the room and the kindness of the staff (they even opened the bar for us). To top this all off, excellent location, a block from the major tube stop of Paddington. Given how expensive EVERYTHING in London is, save some money by staying here and splurging to see a show. How often should one be in a hotel room during a vacation anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Simply a hot, humid dump!”
Reviews.Author: damonandtina
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of students to this hotel and was incredibly underwhelmed by most aspects of the property. To be fair, let me start with a few redeeming qualities that warrant kudos: -Location is fine, near Hyde Park and across the street from a quaint city park that's very tiny. -Included breakfast was the highlight of the hotel. Very pleasant selection of items and seemed relatively clean. -Tiny, but serviceable bar in the lobby that featured a friendly bartender pouring some local brews. Among the MANY negatives of this hotel: -Rooms looked out onto dirty walls of adjoining buildings. Windows barely cracked open to let air in, and NO AIR CONDITIONING IN SUMMER!!!!! -Only ventilation was a tiny fan in the room, and rooms smelled very musty and old. -Bedding wasn't clean. Spots on all blankets and sheets, floor coverings not kept clean. -Noise in hallways leaks through paper thin walls. -One very tiny elevator services entire hotel. -Bathrooms are truly so small that you can barely turn around in them. With some effort I think it'd be possible to use the toilet, shower and sink all at the SAME TIME!! You can't sit in tubs if you're over 5'7". -Front desk staff barely knew what a wake-up call was when I asked for one. No clock in room! -TV was very tiny and got I believe 3 channels. While I still very much enjoyed my trip and wouldn't trade the memories, I'd gladly trade the sleepless and sweaty nights I spent at the Norfolk Plaza. Off the topic, a nearby restaurant recommendation is a pasta place called "Ask". Good food and atmosphere, and not terribly priced. Got to this restaurant, then get a cab to a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bad staff”
Reviews.Author: LondonWorker
Reviews.Content: I got stranded in London, did a late booking over the internet, and arrived about midnight. Was then kept waiting, told that there might be a problem with my booking, ie no rooms, then was kept waiting more as the guy started dealing with someone else who had arrived after me - not a quick simple query, but something turning into a lengthy conversation. When I got irritated and asked him to finish dealing with me first, he told me he was doing me a favour trying to get me a room (which had been properly booked, credit card etc) and went on to say that he could instead just rip up my registration card. At which point I left. I probably didn't behave perfectly, but certainly wasn't aggressive.

Reviews.Title: “They froze us!”
Reviews.Author: jjTorquay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Norfolk Plaza Hotel and I can honestly say I have never had such a poor experience in any hotel around the world. The first impression on entering the hotel is that it reeks of cigarette smoke. The bar is adjacent to the lobby and, as smoking is freely permitted in the bar, it permeates the entire area. Unfortunately, our room was on the ground floor, so the lingering smell made its way to our room also. When we checked in around 2pm, there was no heat in the room. We were told that it was on a timer and wouldn't be on for another couple of hours. There was a howling draft coming through a gap between the window frame and the ledge (also a safety issue in a ground floor room) and we finally complained loudly enough that they turned the heat on. On returning from dinner around 9:30pm, the heat was again off. That night it snowed. When we woke up in the morning - you guessed it - no heat. When my Mother went to take a shower - no hot water. The heat never did come on before we left around 9:30am for the day. We complained to the receptionist who told us she would get someone in to look at the window! When we returned that afternoon, the room had not been made up and again, no heat. I showered that afternoon in hot water, but the next morning there was again no heat and no hot water. Oh and, of course, no complimentary amenities in the bathroom. We complained at check out, but no apologies were given whatsoever. We received a good rate for a hotel in London, but if their way of compensating for offering discounts is to keep the guest in a freezing cold room, I hardly call that Hospitality - or value for money. I strongly advise anyone considering staying in this hotel - think again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: lovedc
Reviews.Content: The good: - only a couple blocks from Paddington Station, which is the endpoint for the Heathrow Express. That means you can be at this hotel 45 minutes after landing (if BA doesn't lose your bags, as they did mine). Good neighborhood, easy to get anywhere else. - my room was very large: a 2 floor suite, in fact, for the price of the double. - plenty of hot water in the shower - if I sat in one corner of the room I could log onto free-hotspot.com which operates free wifi in the neighborhood The bad: - staff lazy and barely competent - walls and ceiling paper thin: I heard guest clomping around above me all night, and the man in the room next door snoring. - furniture the cheapest possible kind, and pretty beat up. Spilled drink stains on the chairs. - hotel suggests you pay them for wireless access, available only in the lobby, when the lobby gets GREAT reception for free-hotspot.com (which, obviously, is free).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and dirty”
Reviews.Author: sarahc70
Reviews.Content: AVOID! This place is horrible, dirty, no hot water for shower. We stayed in room B-2 in the basement, and the bedclothes were dirty and stained, mattresses are barely usable, have no padding and can feel all metal parts. The shower had BLACK grout lines from mold. My travel companion had a cold shower and I was afraid to attempt it, so we left totally disgusted and I was dirty! I was so surprised and shocked because the front steps/sign look very nice!!!!!! I agree with previous reviewer that this place is a scam!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty noisy dump with fancy facade”
Reviews.Author: Staalberg
Reviews.Content: I have serious complaints about the hotel room we rented. Me, my wife and our one-year-old son came there the 15th of July and we had to change hotel the day after. If we weren't so tired we would have changed directly, when we saw and smelled the dirty room with the terrible view. But after one night laying awake, listening to TV-noise, people walking back and forth over our heads all night, run, slam doors and scream in the corridor or doing what they had to do in their toilettes, we had enogh. Also couldn't stand the uncomfortable place without aircondition. A four-star hotel should have at least a simple one. The polish woman at the desk got angry when I two times friendly asked to borrow an electric fan. The air stood totally still, no ventilation at all; we couldn't sleep whole night. Lost appetite totally for breakfast so we changed early next morning. Their business is a fraud. Trying to keep up appearances outside with a fancy entrÃ©e and lounge you are very, very dishonest, the rooms are totally awful. The room we lived in is also a death trap for small children. No.215 has a window with only one hook you can not lock, a half meter from the floor. Hidden behind a curtain. If I hadn't checked the window at first, my son could quickly had climbed up, curiously opened the window and fallen to death ten meters down to the dirty backyard. When I complained, two guys came up and tried to fix it with a stick! Instead of putting a lock to the window. The electric connections in the closet are at least 40 years old and have rusty connections. The furniture is from the early seventies, dirty and worn out. The 20-years old "satellite TV" I had to fix myself when I came so it worked. Anyway, of five channels two of them were German and Arabic. The toilet didn't flush properly, the bathtub worn out, the washbowl was cracked. When I closed the door to the bathroom, three plates fell down from the outside of the tub and crashed on the floor. The bathroom smelled mould. The carpet had big stains, and smelled dirty, the baby couldn't crawl on them. The truth is a crappy, worn out, broken dump with dirty textiles of nylon.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: DanGold
Reviews.Content: Having seen the poor recent reviews - I could not disagree more. The staff are a little aloof, but I expected that. We paid Â£135 for three nights Wednesday to Saturday. Daily rate is Â£120, booked via ebookers. Fantastic value for money. It was clean with reasonable food. It is one minutes walk from Paddington is a quiet square, with no traffic noise. Nice bar. Thumbs up from here.

Reviews.Title: “Bad rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff is not friendly at all, I dont recommend an hour for a visit and looking at it. The dirts are everywhere, room is untidy, the view is on a shared garbage of the neighbors. As a result, the smell of the room is bad. I couldnt stay in the room for an hour, so I changed my hotel and paid a night charge :) I couldnt move my bage from the elevator to my room, becouse the ward was tinny.

Reviews.Title: “Massively overcharged”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Norfolk Plaza during a Heathrow layover and have no complaints about the hotel itself. The rooms are small but tidy enough, it's a two-minute walk from the Heathrow Express at Paddington, and the rate was totally reasonable. My complaint is with the brazen dishonesty of the information booklet in the room, which seemed to indicate that a long-distance phone call to Canada would cost about 60p to a pound per minute. As I was only making one short call and it was a Sunday evening, I went ahead, figuring it was worth even 15 pounds to not have to go looking for a calling card in my jetlagged state. I made an 18-minute call. When I checked out the next morning, I was presented with a bill for 32.50 - a total not too much less than the cost of the room itself. I later spoke with the hotel manager, who declined to reduce the charge and argued that the sample tolls listed in the booklet were only "approximate." Given that I was calling at one of the least expensive times of the week, I can only assume that the manger took the term to mean "approximately half the lowest toll you can possibly expect." In short, not a bad hotel, if you don't mind the manager's apparent comfort with leaving deliberately misleading information in the rooms. And by no means make a phone call from your room under any circumstances. If the building's on fire, fashion a megaphone from your dishonest in-room info booklet and call for help out the window.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl70
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night, at the last minute...the lobby was nice.. but the room was another story..I agree with the previous post SCARY!! The lady at the reception was not friendly at all.. the toliet didn't flush...the tv remote didn't work...I slept in my jeans as I wasn't sure how clean the bed was..The location was convenient and there was a fish and chip shop 2 minutes away...but I would not stay there again...horrible!!!!! Pay a little more and get something decent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel2b
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights, and I must say, that I found it to be not only convenient to transportation buses and underground and heathrow express, but I also found it more spacious then I expected. It was clean,and bed was comfortable, the TV had good reception and adequate channels. I found the reception desk very helpful and the only complaint I have was had to pay for breakfast and it wasn't that great. But I would definately stay here again and I would recommend it. Especially if you need the heathrow express.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel,need more staff!”
Reviews.Author: bigspender1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were attending Live 8 in hyde park. Location is great, 2 minutes walk from the heathrow express and the same to Hyde Park. Room was very clean and a fair size.We were pleasantly surprised ! Only drawback I would say was the fact that they had no dedicated bar person. The guy who checked us in was also in charge of the bar which left us waiting for drinks whilst people checked in. He also decided not to open the bar on the Saturday night which was a bit of a disappointment as we were looking forward to a wee nightcap after the concert. He told us he was too busy and didn't have the staff to enable him to open the bar. If there were more staff here then I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a triple room which was spacious, clean and very comfortable. We found the staff to be very helpful and courteous.The hotel was situated in a delightful tree lined square very convenient for Paddington Station and also a fifteen minute walk up Edgware Road to Marble Arch/Oxford Street. The breakfast room was very pleasant and the staff attentive. There was a good choice in the continental breakfast selection and the full english breakfast was very good.We would definitely stay in this hotel next time we come to London for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: damien
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel between our trip to South Africa and our return to Toronto. Our room was basic but very clean. We had a bright twin room on the first floor which was non smoking, overlooking a little park. The TV had numerous channels, there was also a Tea and coffee maker. The toilet although small had a very good shower and bath. The Continental breakfast was most satisfying with a choice of cereal, yogurt, cheese, meat, rolls and a pot of tea or coffee. This could be upgraded to a full English breakfast for a couple of pounds. The hotel was within easy reach of Paddington Station. We actually walked all the way to Trafalgar Square , Oxford Circus and along the Mall to Buckingham Palace. The staff were very helpful and gave us a map where they marked all the places that we wanted to visit. There were many good restaurants and shops within a few minutes of the hotel. We loved the Fish and Chip shop at the end of the road. Beware of Discount Theatre Ticket sellers. Make sure that you know the actual price of the ticket and their commission . We paid 90 pounds for 2 tickets which were only worth 20 pounds each.

HotelInfo.Name: Norfolk Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 29/33 Norfolk Square | Paddington, London W2 1RX, England
